oai_dc:dc.dc:title: President Franklin D. Roosevelt speaking at the dedication ceremony
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This photograph shows President Franklin D. Roosevelt speaking at the dedication ceremony for the Great Smoky Mountains National Park.

In September of 1940, President Franklin D. Roosevelt came to East Tennessee to officially dedicate the Great Smoky Mountains National Park. The President delivered his address at Newfound Gap at the main crest of the mountains that serves as a boundary between Tennessee and North Carolina.
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: Great Smoky Mountains National Park (N.C. and Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Great Smoky Mountains National Park (N.C. and Tenn.)
